name: USCorePractitionerRoleProfile
title: US Core PractitionerRole Profile
description: This profile sets minimum expectations for the PractitionerRole Resource to record, search, and fetch the practitioner role for a practitioner to promote interoperability and adoption through common implementation.  It identifies which core elements, extensions, vocabularies, and value sets **SHALL** be present and constrains the way the elements are used and constrains the way the elements are used when using the profile.  It provides the floor for standards development for specific use cases.  The requirements for the US Core Practitioner were drawn from the [Argonaut Provider Directory](http://www.fhir.org/guides/argonaut/pd//release1/index.html), [IHE Healthcare Provider Directory](http://ihe.net/uploadedFiles/Documents/ITI/IHE_ITI_Suppl_HPD.pdf) and the [ONC Provider Directory Workshop](https://confluence.oncprojectracking.org/display/PDW/Workshop+Documents).

elements.name: id
elements.short: Logical id of this artifact
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.short: Metadata about the resource
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.short: Language of the resource content
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.short: Contained, inline Resources
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.short: Additional content defined by implementations
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

elements.short: Business Identifiers that are specific to a role/location
elements.description: Business Identifiers that are specific to a role/location.

elements.name: active
elements.short: Whether this practitioner role record is in active use
elements.description: Whether this practitioner role record is in active use.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: period
elements.short: The period during which the practitioner is authorized to perform in these role(s)
elements.description: The period during which the person is authorized to act as a practitioner in these role(s) for the organization.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: (ServD maps Practitioners and Organizations via another entity, so this concept is not available)

elements.name: practitioner
elements.short: Practitioner that is able to provide the defined services for the organization
elements.description: Practitioner that is able to provide the defined services for the organization.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: organization
elements.short: Organization where the roles are available
elements.description: The organization where the Practitioner performs the roles associated.

elements.name: code
elements.short: Roles which this practitioner may perform
elements.description: Roles which this practitioner is authorized to perform for the organization.

binding.description: Indicates specific responsibility of an individual within the care team, such as Primary physician, Team coordinator, Caregiver, etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.description: The location(s) at which this practitioner provides care.

mapping.map:

elements.name: system
elements.short: phone | fax | email | pager | url | sms | other
elements.description: Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: value
elements.short: The actual contact point details
elements.description: The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication system (i.e. phone number or email address).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: use
elements.short: home | work | temp | old | mobile - purpose of this contact point
elements.description: Identifies the purpose for the contact point.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: XTN.2 - but often indicated by field

elements.name: rank
elements.short: Specify preferred order of use (1 = highest)
elements.description: Specifies a preferred order in which to use a set of contacts. ContactPoints with lower rank values are more preferred than those with higher rank values.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: period
elements.short: Time period when the contact point was/is in use
elements.description: Time period when the contact point was/is in use.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: availableTime
elements.short: Times the Service Site is available
elements.description: A collection of times the practitioner is available or performing this role at the location and/or healthcareservice.

elements.name: daysOfWeek
elements.short: mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun
elements.description: Indicates which days of the week are available between the start and end Times.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: allDay
elements.short: Always available? e.g. 24 hour service
elements.description: Is this always available? (hence times are irrelevant) e.g. 24 hour service.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: availableStartTime
elements.short: Opening time of day (ignored if allDay = true)
elements.description: The opening time of day. Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: availableEndTime
elements.short: Closing time of day (ignored if allDay = true)
elements.description: The closing time of day. Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: notAvailable
elements.short: Not available during this time due to provided reason
elements.description: The practitioner is not available or performing this role during this period of time due to the provided reason.

elements.name: description
elements.short: Reason presented to the user explaining why time not available
elements.description: The reason that can be presented to the user as to why this time is not available.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: during
elements.short: Service not available from this date
elements.description: Service is not available (seasonally or for a public holiday) from this date.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: availabilityExceptions
elements.short: Description of availability exceptions
elements.description: A description of site availability exceptions, e.g. public holiday availability. Succinctly describing all possible exceptions to normal site availability as details in the available Times and not available Times.

elements.short: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the practitioner with this role
elements.description: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the practitioner with this role.
